conclusion: Identify what the graph actually shows
The vertical label is 'x / t (m s⁻¹)' indicating velocity
The ordinate must be the instantaneous velocity v(t), dealing with a v–t graph
At t = 0 s, v = 10 m s⁻¹; dashed extension passes through v = 0 m s⁻¹ at t = –2 s
Determine the acceleration (slope of the v–t graph)
Slope a = (10 m s⁻¹ – 0 m s⁻¹) / (0 s – (–2 s)) = 5 m s⁻²
Use the acceleration to find the velocity at t = +2 s
The car’s speed at the end of the 2nd second is 20 m s⁻¹
